thread.title: GOP's Ben Carson to hold rally in Loudoun on Sunday evening
thread.title_full: GOP's Ben Carson to hold rally in Loudoun on Sunday evening

author: acain@timesdispatch.com(Andrew Cain)
title: GOP's Ben Carson to hold rally in Loudoun on Sunday evening
text:
the associated press CORRECTION GOP 2016-Carson 
CORRECTS DATE TO SEPT. 23, NOT 22 - Republican presidential candidate Dr. Ben Carson speaks to the crowd during a campaign rally held at Spring Arbor University in Spring Arbor, Mich. Wednesday, Sept. 23, 2015. (Jessica Christian/Jackson Citizen Patriot via AP) LOCAL STATIONS OUT; LOCAL INTERNET OUT; MANDATORY CREDIT ADVERTISEMENT Posted: Thursday, September 24, 2015 5:15 pm 
Retired neurosurgeon Ben Carson, among the leaders in GOP presidential polls nationally, will bring his campaign to Northern Virginia on Sunday evening. 
Carson plans a 90-minute rally at Park View High School in Sterling, beginning at 7 p.m. 
Loudoun is a large swing county in this key swing state. In 2012, President Barack Obama, a Democrat, carried the county with 51.6 percent of the vote to 47.1 percent for Republican Mitt Romney. 
In recent days, Carson has worked to clarify his remarks after a Sunday interview on NBC’s “Meet the Press” in which he said: “I would not advocate that we put a Muslim in charge of this nation.” 
Carson has subsequently said he does not care about an individual’s religious beliefs as long as the person embraces the U.S. Constitution and is willing to place it above the person’s religion. 
Carson was in Richmond last October as the keynote speaker of the Family Foundation of Virginia’s annual gala at the Greater Richmond Convention Center. 
acain@timesdispatch.com
